conclusion: To solve the problem, the flow path of the liquid will be analyzed based on the positions of outlets and baffles to determine which container (E or F) the liquid flows into.
The image shows outlets labeled A, B, C, and D positioned above containers labeled E and F, with baffles and colored paths indicating possible liquid routes.
Outlets are positioned at the top of the image, and containers E and F are positioned below the outlets.
The liquid from outlet A flows to the left, passing through a baffle.
The liquid from outlet B also moves to the left, joining A’s path.
Outlet C's liquid takes a different path, moving rightward.
Outlet D’s liquid continues the rightward flow.
The liquids from A and B merge into a common path, which moves toward container E.
The liquids from C and D continue to the right and will reach container F.
Liquid from outlets A and B will end up in container E, and liquid from outlets C and D will end up in container F.
The liquid will flow into container E.
